_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Scott's Liquid Gold--Inc., (SLG) is a public corporation manufacturing and marketing, nationally and internationally, houehold chemical products in liquid and aerosol forms, namely, Scott's Liquid Gold Wood Cleaner and Preservative and a single phase air Freshener, Touch of Scent.  67 employees work at SLG's corporate headquarters and manufacturing facility located at 4880 Havana Street, Denver, CO.  The SLG process which
is subject to 40 CFR Part 58 is the receiving, storage, transfer, and pressurization of a 2Qaerosol container, utilizing an aerosol grade propellant (100% 1,1 Difluoroethane), trade name 152A.  Written operating procedures requiring daily personal and mechanical monitoring are closely followed to prevent no more than 13,000 gallons of 152A from being present in an 18000 gallon capacity, non-pressurized outside above-ground storage
tank.  The tank is located in a fenced, secured area, an estimated 80' from the north wall of the facility and is video monitored 24 hours/day, 7 days/week.  It is also physically inspected on a daily basis by maintenance and security professionals and weekly by production and regulatory/safety professionals.  Any deficiencies 
are documented and followed up with immediate remedial action.  Strict Good Manufacturing Processes and state of the art active/passive detection, prevention and fire/explosion repression systems are utilized to minimize the possibility of any loss scenarios.  SLG is in complete compliance with local, state and federal 
regulations.  It is the philosophy of SLG to go beyond minimum requirements to approach compliance in a comprehensive, multifaceted approach to aid in the prevention, detection and control of loss potentials.  SLG is recognized as a Star worksite under OSHA's Voluntary Protection Program, which is the highest level of recognition.  They have participated in the VPP since 2003.  Although SLG has not experienced any loss incidents since beginning to utilize 152A in 2004 and its predec
essor 152a/A-17.8218 in 1996, response will be immediate with appropriate preventative and protection measures, after observing or otherwise learning of the most remote possibility of loss potential.
